description.p: Product_in_slot Identifies the relationship between a Slot and a product that is capable to attach in the slot.
The module does not seem to support the relationship between a slot and the product that is fitted to the slot.
I think that we need to have a "product_as_indvidual_in_slot" to represent the actual product that is fitted to the slot.

comment.description: The relationship is provided by the next_assembly_usage relationship. I have corrected the definition.

issue.description: Product_in_slot should be a subtype of View_definition_relationship to allow the application of Item_usage_effectivity.

comment.description: Raised as a UK ballot comment.
Product_in_slot is a subtype of View_definition_usage, which is a subtype of View_definition_relationship, hence no action required.

issue.description: Processing: data/modules/attachment_slot/nav/mapping_view.xml Mapping check shows following errors: Error Map35: ERROR in subtyping in PATH: connector_on is not a subtype of product_definition_relationship
The ID for term attachment slot is "attachment_Slot" It should be "attachment_slot"

Product_in_slot is a subtype of View_definition_usage. What is the purpose of the inherited relating_view related_view attributes? Should they not be renamed/redeclared to: related_view to product relating_view to slot

comment.description: Resolved as sugggested. The question was raised, should Slot_on_product be modelled in a similar way to Product_on_slot? The suggestion was rejected because the definition for view_definition_usage includes "it is considered that the related product is used in the context of the relating product" ... this is true for Product_in_slot but I would say that Slot_on_product is about this "product" (slot) is a feature of this parent product. (answer Tim King)

issue.description: Made sure that the correct attribute order was used on all entities
Use standard wording for relating / related attributes
Use phrases for attributes and indicate which are optional
Improve the definitions of the attributes product and slot.
